intro: Orophea sivarajanii, commonly known as the Sivarajan's star tree, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often at elevations between 600 and 1,500 meters. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
